group.label: Advanced Settings
group.comment: The advanced settings can change how the search works. Please edit them with caution and only if you know what they are doing.

field.label: use-url-parameter
field.comment: If set to true, the http parameters of the current search are pushed to the browser url.

field.label: use-cache
field.comment: This value determines, if the browser should cache previous search requests or not. Some browsers support this feature and therefore speed up the search for repeated requests.

field.label: default-query
field.comment: Determines which search term should be used by default. Default is '*'

field.label: only-search-params
field.comment: If present, URL parameters like 'channel' and 'sid' are omitted in the URL. This can be used in conjunction with parameter-whitelist

field.label: parameter-whitelist
field.comment: If any URL parameters are omitted through other attributes like use-url-parameter="false" or only-search-params you can add specific important parameters manually. Just use a comma separated list like: parameter-whitelist="param1,myParam"

field.label: add-params
field.comment: With this property you can deliver standard parameters which will then be attached to the search request. Example: param1=abc,param2=xyz.

field.label: add-tracking-params
field.comment: With this property you can deliver standard parameters which are attached to every tracking request. Example: param1=abc,param2=xyz.

field.label: keep-url-params
field.comment: Determines if parameters which are written into the URL should be kept.

field.label: use-found-words
field.comment: For found records, FACT-Finder is capable of returning the words which lead to the find. The determination of these words costs performance. It is therefore deactivated by default. If true, words are created. If false, words are not created.

field.label: use-campaigns
field.comment: Use this parameter if you want to prevent the campaign manager from checking if there is a campaign for this search request.If true, campaigns are analyzed and returned. If false, campaigns are ignored. Default is true.

field.label: generate-advisor-tree
field.comment: Is used with advisor campaigns. Please refer the campaign manager documentation. If true, the whole question-answer-tree is returned with the advisor campaign. If false, only the currently active questions and their answers are returned. Default is false.

field.label: disable-cache
field.comment: Controls the usage of search result caches. If true, cache is ignored. If false, cache is used. Default is false.

field.label: use-personalization
field.comment: Allows activating/deactivating of request personalization. If true, the search result is personalized if the personalization module is active and all other requirements are met. If false, the search result is not personalized. Default is true.

field.label: use-semantic_enhancer
field.comment: Allows activating/deactivating of the semantic enrichment of requests. If true, the search result is semantically enriched if the enhanced module is activated and all other requirements are met. If false, the search result is not semantically enriched. Default value is true.

field.label: use-aso
field.comment: Allows activating/deactivating of automated search optimization. If true, the search result is automatically optimized. If false, the search result is not optimized. Default is true.

field.label: use-browser-history
field.comment: If true, the search history is pushed to the browser history, even without using url parameter. Default is true.

field.label: disable-single-hit-redirect
field.comment: If true, disables the automatic redirect to the product detail page if only one record is found.
